prompt.p: Adult haemoglobin (HbA) is a tetramer (2α-like + 2β-like globins) associated with a haem group. Fetal haemoglobin (HbF) is different.
What is the haemoglobin structure of fetal haemoglobin (HbF)?

modalFeedback.p:
Option E (a2α2) is Correct. Adult Hb comprises HbA (a2β2), and makes up the majority of Hb, along with HbA 2 (a2d2). Sickle cell disease, due to abnormal haemoglobins resulting from a base change in the β globin gene, is not detected at the time of birth since the main haemoglobin in early life is HbF (a2α2), which does not contain the β chain.
Sickle cell disease is generally the result of homozygous HbSS (a 2 β S 2 ), but may also be caused by interactions with other abnormal haemoglobins, such as:

ul.li: HbC (resulting in HbSC, a 2 β S β C )
β thalassaemia (resulting in Hb Sβ+ thalassaemia, a 2 β S β+thal or β° thal)
HbD (resulting in HbSD, a 2 β S β D ).

modalFeedback.p:
All of these produce significant symptoms but SS and Sβ° are the most severe. The parents of individuals with HbSS SCD are both carriers of the β S gene, i.e. they usually both have sickle cell trait.
Option A (a2β2) is Incorrect. This is normal adult haemoglobin.
Option B (a 2 β S 2 ) is Incorrect.
This is HbSS.
Option C (a 2 β S β C ) is Incorrect.
This is HbSC.
Option D (a2d2) is Incorrect. This is a variation of HbA, HbA 2 .
